# RSA Madlibs
We ran into some weird puzzles we think may mean something, can you help me solve one? Connect with `nc 2018shell.picoctf.com 18148`.

## Solution
This was a simple [mad libs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mad_Libs) challenge that required me to review the [RSA Algorithm](https://simple.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_algorithm). To solve this, I wrote a script that implements the basic RSA functions to `encrypt`, `decrypt`, and the [Extended Euclidean Algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extended_Euclidean_algorithm).

## Exploit
It became tedious to always enter the solution to questions, so I put all the inputs from `nc 2018shell.picoctf.com 18148` in [input.txt](input.txt) and piped that into `python solve.py` and I piped the output of the solve script into netcat.

```
$ cat input.txt | python solve.py | nc 2018shell.picoctf.com 18148
Hello, Welcome to RSA Madlibs
Keeping young children entertained, since, well, nev3r
Tell us how to fill in the blanks, or if it's even possible to do so
Everything, input and output, is decimal, not hex
...
#
# I've omitted the output here to save space.
#
...
YAHHH! That one was a great madlib!!!


If you convert the last plaintext to a hex number, then ascii, you'll find what you're searching for ;)
```

I've written some code, towards the end of [solve.py](solve.py), that converts the plaintext flag into ascii characters.

```
$ cat input.txt | python solve.py 
y
8815769761
y
77773
N
y
6256003596
y

N
y

y
240109877286251840533272915662757983981706320845661471802585807564915966910385128423526644303028605
picoCTF{d0_u_kn0w_th3_w@y_2_RS@_b38be18a}
```


## Hints
- [RSA Algorithm](https://simple.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_algorithm)
